results.title: Morphoproteomics Identifies SIRT1 and EZH2 Pathways as Commonalities in B-cell Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia: Pathogenetic Implications and Opportunities for Therapeutic Intervention.
results.text_hl: Data mining of the National Library of Medicine's MEDLINE Database and Ingenuity Pathway analysis revealed agents of relatively low @DISEASE_Drug_Related_Side_Effects_and_Adverse_Reactions @DISEASE_MESH:D064420 @@@toxicity@@@-@CHEMICAL_Melatonin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008550 @@@melatonin@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, @CHEMICAL_Curcumin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D003474 @@@curcumin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_sulforaphane @CHEMICAL_MESH:C016766 @@@sulforaphane@@@-that are capable of inhibiting directly or pharmacogenomically one or both of the @GENE_SIRT1 @GENE_23411 @@@SIRT1@@@ and @GENE_EZH2 @GENE_2146 @@@EZH2@@@ pathways and should, in a combinatorial fashion, remove the block in differentiation and decrease the proliferation of the @<m>DISEASE_Leukemia_Biphenotypic_Acute</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015456 @@@B-cell ALL@@@ lymphoblasts.

citations.NLM: Brown RE, Konopka KE, Weerasinghe P, Jaitly V, Dasgupta A, McGuire MF, Nguyen ND. Morphoproteomics Identifies SIRT1 and EZH2 Pathways as Commonalities in B-cell Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia: Pathogenetic Implications and Opportunities for Therapeutic Intervention. Ann Clin Lab Sci. 2017 Jan;47(1):3-9. PMID: 28249909
